intro: Radlkoferella nitidula, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically features a compact rosette of fleshy, smooth, and often bluish-gray leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. Its succulent leaves and short growth habit are adaptations to its harsh, dry environment. Radlkoferella nitidula is often found in rocky soils and is considered a member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
